# Atlantic Fintech Daily Briefing
### Friday, February 20, 2026

---

## 🌍 Top 5 Global Fintech News

- **[Fintech founder charged with fraud; AI app found to be humans in the Philippines](https://techcrunch.com/2025/04/10/fintech-founder-charged-with-fraud-after-ai-shopping-app-found-to-be-powered-by-humans-in-the-philippines/)** — *Hacker News* — A fintech founder faces fraud charges after their supposedly AI-powered shopping app was revealed to be operated by human workers in the Philippines.

- **[Americans see their savings vanish in Synapse fintech crisis](https://www.cnbc.com/2024/11/22/synapse-bankruptcy-thousands-of-americans-see-their-savings-vanish.html)** — *Hacker News* — Thousands of Americans lost access to their savings following the bankruptcy of fintech middleware provider Synapse, highlighting serious risks in the banking-as-a-service model.

- **[Open Banking and Payments Competition](https://www.bitsaboutmoney.com/archive/open-banking-and-payments-competition/)** — *Hacker News* — A deep-dive analysis explores how open banking frameworks are reshaping competition in the payments landscape globally.

- **[Apple acquires UK open banking startup Credit Kudos](https://ffnews.com/newsarticle/apple-acquires-uk-open-banking-startup-credit-kudos/)** — *Hacker News* — Apple made a strategic move into open banking by acquiring UK-based Credit Kudos, signalling big tech's growing interest in financial data infrastructure.

- **[Fintech is making credit cards weirder](https://workweek.com/2022/08/05/fintech-is-making-credit-cards-weirder/)** — *Hacker News* — Fintech innovation is pushing credit card products into increasingly niche and unconventional territory, challenging traditional bank offerings.

## 🍁 Top 5 Canadian Fintech News

- **[Canada calls screen scraping 'unsecure,' sets Open Banking target for 2023](https://finledger.com/2021/08/09/canada-sets-open-banking-target-for-2023/)** — *Hacker News* — Canada signalled a major regulatory shift by labelling screen scraping insecure and committing to a formal open banking framework, a file that remains actively relevant to Canadian fintech today.

- **[Canada's annual inflation rate edged down to 2.3% in January with decline in gas prices](https://www.cbc.ca/news/business/canada-inflation-cpi-january-2026-9.7093329?cmp=rss)** — *CBC Business* — Canada's inflation eased slightly to 2.3% in January 2026, driven largely by lower gas prices, with implications for consumer spending and financial planning across the country.

- **[Cohere co-founder Nick Frosst wants to build more Canadian, less Silicon Valley-centric AI](https://betakit.com/cohere-co-founder-nick-frosst-wants-to-build-more-canadian-less-silicon-valley-centric-ai/)** — *BetaKit* — Cohere co-founder Nick Frosst is advocating for a distinctly Canadian approach to AI development, pushing back against Silicon Valley dominance in the sector.

- **[PrairiesCan invests $3 million in Black entrepreneurship](https://betakit.com/prairescan-invests-3-million-in-black-entrepreneurship/)** — *BetaKit* — The federal regional development agency is directing $3 million toward Black-owned businesses on the Prairies, reflecting a broader push for financial inclusion and equitable access to capital in Canada.

- **[US Poses Greater Security Threat Than China, Canadians Say in Poll](https://financialpost.com/pmn/business-pmn/us-poses-greater-security-threat-than-china-canadians-say-in-poll)** — *Financial Post* — A new poll finds a majority of Canadians now view the United States as a greater security threat than China, a sentiment with growing implications for Canada's economic sovereignty and financial sector strategy.
